circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: The unidentified was hitch-hiking when he was struck by a car that went out of control near the Fair Deal Market on US 19-21. A motorist who had given the hitch-hiker a ride just before his death told police the man told him he was en route to Bluefield where he was born to get a birth certificate so he could join the Army. He also told, the motorist he was raised in Chicago, IL., but his parents were dead. He never divulged his name.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Wearing a black pair of Levis, a blue and grey checkered shirt and jungle boots.

agency.name: West Virginia Office of the Chief Medical Examiner

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On December 28, 2021, a bear hunter found what he believed to be human remains in the Monongahela National Forest, and reported his finding to the WV State Police. The bear hunter led law enforcement out to the location on December 29, 2021, where law enforcement confirmed that they were human remains, collected the bones and clothing, and reported the death to the WV OCME. The items were packaged for transport to the WV OCME and an autopsy was conducted on January 4, 2022.  During the course of the WV OCME investigation to this point, no physical evidence has been provided that is sufficient to forensically establish the identity of the decedent. Anthropological examination has been conducted and has determined the remains represent a single subject.

agency.name: West Virginia Office of the Chief Medical Examiner

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery:
This 1st paragraph was from Case# 20-4601 (Doe# 2459) 
“Decedent was found by passer by in a wooded area approximately 75 yards from the 4 1/2 mile marker on I64 West. The passer by saw a skull at 1805 on 07/15/2020 and called 911. WVSP responded and pronounced the decedent on scene at 1843 on 07/15/2020. Debris was moved and a nearly complete ( missing hands and left foot ) set of skeletal remains was found clothed in a jacket and pants. A small caliber semiautomatic hand gun was found to the decedent's left side. The weapon was badly rusted and SN# and make and model could not be determined. There was what appeared to be a gunshot to the area behind the decedent's left ear with exit to the right temple area. An inhaler was found on scene but no ID was found. WVSP is investigating as a possible suicide.”

The following paragraph is from new case # 20-4612 (Doe# 2460).

On Thursday, July 16, 2020, Trooper went back to the site where the skeletal remains were located on Wednesday, July 15, 2020 at 1805hrs (06:05pm) by a passer-by.  Approximately 98 feet from the previous remains, Trooper located a foot & ankle bones of a left foot still inside a dark brown hiking boot (with a gray & black sock).  According to the CoME, the boot matches the one found on the skeletal remains found the previous day.  The bones were found and pronounced at 1520hrs (03:20pm) by Trooper of the WVSP-Huntington Detachment.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Decedent was found in the middle of the Ohio River at Virginia Point in Kenova, WV on 5/23/20 0920. Decedent was found floating face down by Marathon Gas barge workers. Decedent was lassoed by workers to keep from floating away by barge workers. 911 was contacted and decedent was retrieved by VFD on 5/23/20 1015. Decedent was pronounced on 5/23/20 1047 by EMS on scene.
